message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presentation of lower extremity edema, hematuria, proteinuria, and decreased complement levels suggest a renal pathology. Among the options, diffuse mesangial cell proliferation with capillary wall thickening is most associated with IgA nephropathy, which is commonly seen in patients with opioid use disorder. Apple-green birefringence on Congo red stain is a characteristic of amyloidosis, glomerular basement membrane thinning and splitting is seen in membranous nephropathy, and a normal appearing glomerulus would be unusual in this clinical setting.

Option A is characteristic of amyloidosis, which is not the most likely diagnosis for this patient. Option D is not a characteristic finding of any specific glomerular disease.

Among the options, diffuse mesangial cell proliferation with capillary wall thickening is most commonly seen in IgA nephropathy, which is the most common cause of glomerulonephritis worldwide.
